meanings.definition: To bring under control or conquer
meanings.sent1: The brave knight was able to subdue the fierce dragon with his sword.
meanings.sent2: The police worked together to subdue the unruly crowd during the protest.
meanings.sent3: Trying to subdue a wild squirrel with a hug is not a good idea.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to subdue her fear of heights was like a warrior facing a mighty foe.
meanings.sent5: The magician used his powers to subdue the raging storm, bringing peace to the land.

meanings.sent1: Taking deep breaths can help subdue your nerves before a big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The soothing music helped to subdue the baby and lull it to sleep.
meanings.sent3: She tried to subdue her laughter during the serious meeting, but it kept bubbling up.
meanings.sent4: The gentle rain helped to subdue the raging fire, bringing relief to the firefighters.
meanings.sent5: His kind words were able to subdue her fears and bring comfort to her heart.

meanings.definition: To overcome or reduce in intensity
meanings.sent1: The medication helped to subdue the pain in her knee after the injury.
meanings.sent2: The bright sunlight can sometimes subdue the colors of a painting, making them less vibrant.
meanings.sent3: She tried to subdue her excitement about the upcoming trip, but it was hard to contain.
meanings.sent4: The chef used spices to subdue the strong taste of the fish, making it more palatable.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds threatened to subdue the beauty of the sunset, but it still shone through.
